TopicTitle: [Request] KSP Main Menu Sheet Music Trumpet

Articles.Content:
Are you able to release the sheet music for the KSP Theme Song, i would love to play it on my trumpet!

For clarification, this right here:
Ooh yay thanks. I was busy compiling this for piano myself but this is better.

here https://www.dropbox.com/s/03hvdqaiqzkt4gv/Kerbal%20Space%20Program%20Main%20Theme.pdf

That version is a bit limited.

There is a full piano transcription here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/57173-Music-KSP-Main-Theme-Transcription-(Piano)

I have been working on a trumpet arrangement... BUT it has been delayed because of the limited range of a trumpet.

A trumpet can cover about two octaves, and since the KSP theme makes a full octave jump halfway a trumpet can't cover a 'literal' transposition (unless you are a AAA trumpeter)

Such an arrangement would have to be shifted within the same chords and the writer would have to use other mechanics to express the more confident second half.

Unfortunately, my knowledge of wind instruments is limited and therefor I haven't dared releasing any of my experiments.

here https://www.dropbox.com/s/03hvdqaiqzkt4gv/Kerbal%20Space%20Program%20Main%20Theme.pdf

That appears to be piano, is there a trumpet version floating around the internet somewhere? I don't mind if it is a little off.

Rockhem, are you my clone or something?

I wanted the exact same thing! XD

Edited November 22, 2013 by Thomas988

That version is a bit limited.

There is a full piano transcription here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/57173-Music-KSP-Main-Theme-Transcription-(Piano)

I have been working on a trumpet arrangement... BUT it has been delayed because of the limited range of a trumpet.

A trumpet can cover about two octaves, and since the KSP theme makes a full octave jump halfway a trumpet can't cover a 'literal' transposition (unless you are a AAA trumpeter)

Such an arrangement would have to be shifted within the same chords and the writer would have to use other mechanics to express the more confident second half.

Unfortunately, my knowledge of wind instruments is limited and therefor I haven't dared releasing any of my experiments.

When have range limitations deterred a trumpet player? I don't know of any group of musicians more interested in screaming into the high registers than trumpet players.

I don't have sheet music but I do have some of the first recordings HarvesteR made when making the music.

You might be able to hear what notes are played since it contains less instruments and there aren't any sound effects added.

Idk if it's something that you can use... but if you want it you can pm me.

Edit: something struck my mind: with instruments I mean computer-generated instruments that sound like a simple midi conversion.

Edited November 21, 2013 by Blinkin

Well seeing as there's been a bit of thread necromancy here... can somebody make this a mod so it plays when we launch KSP please? aha

Also the 8-bit version that is in the recommended videos after this one

Since this thread has risen from the proverbial to eat all of our brains, does anyone have a working link to the .pdf originally linked by FellipeC, or the piano transcript mentioned by OrtwinS? Both seem to be down
